meanings.definition: Walked or moved aimlessly or idly
meanings.sent1: She trapesed through the park, enjoying the sunshine.
meanings.sent2: The cat trapesed around the house, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent3: The children trapesed through the store, touching everything in sight.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts trapesed from one idea to another, never settling on one.
meanings.sent5: The wind trapesed through the trees, rustling the leaves gently.

meanings.definition: Traveled or journeyed in a leisurely or carefree manner
meanings.sent1: They trapesed along the beach, collecting seashells as they went.
meanings.sent2: The couple trapesed through Europe, taking their time to enjoy each city.
meanings.sent3: The dog trapesed down the street, stopping to sniff at every bush.
meanings.sent4: Her voice trapesed through the room, filling it with warmth and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The river trapesed through the valley, meandering peacefully under the sun.
